content:
# The error indicates that the stone furnace could not accept the coal, possibly because it is already full or does not have space for additional fuel.
# This suggests that the furnace might not be able to take more fuel until it processes some of the current contents.

# Let's check the current inventory of the stone furnace again to confirm its state.
furnace_inventory = inspect_inventory(stone_furnace_entity)
print(f"Furnace Inventory: {furnace_inventory}")

# Since the furnace has copper plates and no iron plates, I will first extract the copper plates to free up space.
extracted_copper_plates = extract_item(Prototype.CopperPlate, position=stone_furnace_entity.position, quantity=3)

# After extracting the copper plates, I will try to insert coal into the furnace again.
insert_item(Prototype.Coal, target=stone_furnace_entity, quantity=5)  # Attempt to insert 5 coal again.

# If successful, I will then insert 1 iron ore into the furnace for smelting.
insert_item(Prototype.IronOre, target=stone_furnace_entity, quantity=1)  # Insert 1 iron ore.

# Finally, I will wait for the smelting process to complete.
for _ in range(30):  # Maximum 30 seconds wait.
    current_inventory = inspect_inventory(stone_furnace_entity)
    if current_inventory.get(Prototype.IronPlate, 0) >= 1:  # Wait until I have at least 1 iron plate.
        break
    sleep(1)
else:
    raise Exception("Smelting timeout for iron ore - please check resources.")

# Once the smelting is complete, I'll extract the iron plate to proceed with crafting the assembling machine.
extracted_iron_plate = extract_item(Prototype.IronPlate, position=stone_furnace_entity.position, quantity=1)

# Now attempt to craft the assembling machine again.
craft_item(Prototype.AssemblingMachine1, quantity=1)

# Finally, check the inventory after crafting the assembling machine.
print(f"Inventory after crafting assembling machine: {inspect_inventory()}")
